title: Define Project Scope and Requirements
description: Gather and document the project's scope, objectives, and requirements, including the definition of consciousness flow, data sources, visualization needs, target users, ethical considerations, potential challenges or limitations, and system architecture.

title: Design System Architecture
description: Design the overall system architecture, including components for data ingestion, processing, storage, and visualization, as well as the communication between components.

title: Define Data Models and Schemas
description: Design the data models and schemas for storing and representing consciousness flow data, including individual and collective consciousness states, events, and metadata. Consider incorporating temporal data structures to capture the dynamic nature of consciousness flow over time. Additionally, explore the integration of external data sources, such as brain activity data or social media feeds, to enrich the consciousness flow representation.

title: Develop Data Ingestion and Processing Components
description: Implement components for ingesting and processing consciousness flow data from various sources, including sensors, surveys, and other data sources.

title: Design and Implement Visualization Components
description: Design and develop the user interface and visualization components for displaying and interacting with consciousness flow data, including individual and collective visualizations.
